title.narrative: OUTPUT 4: CONDUCIVE BEHAVIOURS & PRACTICES FOR CHILD PROTECTION IN DEV. & EMERGEN

description.narrative: By 2022, duty-bearers and rights-holders have improved, conducive attitudes and practices, that contribute to positive social and cultural norms, which prevent harmful practices and violence against children, including in developmental and emergency situations. , which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, 65 % of girls and boys under-5 are registered in Pakistan, with universal birth registration achieved and embedded within civil registration and vital statistics (CRVS) systems in two provinces, children access appropriate child protection preventive and/or response services, primarily through public case management and referral system in at least two provinces, and communities practice positive behaviours contributing towards a protective environment for children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, duty-bearers and rights-holders have improved, conducive attitudes and practices, that contribute to positive social and cultural norms, which prevent harmful practices and violence against children, including in developmental and emergency situations.

description.narrative: A framework to guide the implementation of prevention of abuse, violence and exploitation of children as well as promotion of child protection services is being developed by the Ministry of Human Rights with support from UNICEF. The framework, once completed in 2020, will increase focused preventive activities in the various provinces. Meanwhile, 326,169 adolescents were reached directly or indirectly and equipped with the knowledge and skills to participate in decision-making through training and peer-to-peer interactions. Child protection messages, including mine risk education and services were also provided to persons affected by emergency situations and reached 49,710 people. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of parents/caregivers and community members who understand benefits and process of and thus registering births of under 5 children.

actual.value: 2019:14,005 people including 12,629 children (4,295 girls and 8,334 boys) and 1,376 adults (853 women, 523 men)

title.narrative: Number of people who participate in social and behavior change communication interventions promoting elimination of VAC through UNICEF programmes
Percentage of UNICEF-targeted girls and boys in humanitarian situations provided with psychosocial support, including access to child friendly spaces with intersectoral programming interventions

actual.value: 2019:49,710 people including 41,180 children (14,538 girls, 26,642 boys) and 8,530 adults (4,881 women, 3,649 men)
